definitions.definition: a senior priest in charge of the work of the Church in a city or district

examples.text: He was appointed Bishop of Ely.
He’s the diocesan bishop and he has three suffragan bishops to help him.

definitions.definition: a piece used in the game of chess that is like a bishop’s hat in shape and can move any number of squares in a diagonal line

wordOrigin: Old English biscop, bisceop, based on Greek episkopos ‘overseer’, from epi ‘above’ + -skopos ‘-looking’.
